title: Schema for definition of processor registers/fuses for Secure Provision Tool and SPSDK
description: Copyright NXP 2020-2025, Schema for definition of processor registers for Secure Provision Tool and SPSDK
title: Definition of the abstract register. Do not use `additionalProperties` here, as the inheritance would not work

name.title: Name of the register to be displayed in UI.

deprecated_names.title: Optional list of alternative/backward compatible names for the register.

description.title: Description of the register to be displayed in tooltip.

offset_int.title: Offset of the register to the peripheral address space. -1 if the fuse address is not published.

index_int.title: Index of the fuse used as parameter for blhost.

is_reserved.title: Whether the register is completely reserved.

access.title: Access to the register: Read/Write; Read-Only or Write-Only

default_value_int.title: After reset value. -1 if not specified or value specified in bit-fields.

individual_write_lock.title: Type of individual write lock. 'none'=no individual lock for the register; 'user'=user configurable lock (optional); 'always_lock'=always generate lock after write; 'implicit/implicit_16bytes'=register/16bytes block/ will be locked automatically without lock parameter;

calculated.title: Optional information how the register value should be calculated; None if the register is not calculated.

method.title: Method, how the register is calculated. The following methods are supported: `inverse` - inversion of another register, 'virtual_counter' - virtual value of counter register.

src_register_id.title: Reference to another register used as source for calculation. See method for info, how the register is used.

reg_width.title: Width of the register, in bits.

min_value_int.title: Minimal value of the `integer` style of the register. 0 by default.

max_value_int.title: Maximal value of the `integer` style of the register. -1 represents maximal value derived for the register width.

bitfields.title: Information about register bit-fields. This information is optional and it is provided only if register contains >1 bitfield.
